column3: US v Phua, 14-cr-00249, US District Court, District of Nevada (Las Vegas).
column4: The FBI alleged that Mr Phua is a "high-ranking member" of the 14K Triad.
column5: The judge ruled that prosecutors had failed to connect all the evidence to Phua and other defendants in the case. The defense argued that Phua had been in the rooms at the Wynn Macau by chance. On delivering his verdict, the judge said the Public Prosecution Office had failed to prove that the computers and papers seized from the rooms belonged to the defendants. Thomas Goldstein, one of his lawyers, said in a statement "Today, his faith in the American justice system was completely vindicated." The judge also threw out the evidence obtained from searches of two other villas the group used because a warrant was based on the earlier illegal entry to Phua's suite. Prosecutors said they were reviewing Gordon's rulings suppressing the evidence for a possible appeal.

column3: US v Phua, 14-cr-00249, US District Court, District of Nevada (Las Vegas).
column4: The FBI alleged that Mr Phua is a "high-ranking member" of the 14K Triad.
column5: Thomas Goldstein, one of Phua's lawyers, said in a statement, “Paul Phua stayed in the United States to defeat these charges because he was innocent and because the government’s misconduct made the case even more unjust. Today, his faith in the American justice system was completely vindicated.” The judge ruled that prosecutors had failed to connect all the evidence to Phua and other defendants in the case and noted that there was a lack of connecting elements. The defense argued that Phua had been in the rooms at the Wynn Macau by chance, arriving for a meeting on a potential business project just minutes before the police raid. The judge also threw out the evidence obtained from searches of two other villas the group used because a warrant was based on the earlier illegal entry to Phua’s suite.

column3: US v Phua, 14-cr-00249, US District Court, District of Nevada (Las Vegas).
column4: The FBI alleged that Mr Phua is a "high-ranking member" of the 14K Triad.
column5: Thomas Goldstein, one of his lawyers said in a statement that Paul Phua stayed in the United States to defeat these charges because he was innocent and the government’s misconduct made the case even more unjust. Judge Lei Wai Seng noted in his ruling that there was a lack of connecting elements and the court could not make any connection. Thomas Goldstein said that he was grateful to the court for recognizing his client’s innocence. The defense argued that Phua had been in the rooms at the Wynn Macau by chance. Judge Seng said the Public Prosecution Office had failed to prove that the computers and papers seized from the rooms belonged to the defendants. The prosecution has 20 days to appeal the verdict.

Thomas Goldstein, one of his lawyers, said in a statement “Paul Phua stayed in the United States to defeat these charges because he was innocent and because the government’s misconduct made the case even more unjust. Today, his faith in the American justice system was completely vindicated.” The judge noted “there is a lack of connecting elements” in the case. The defense argued that Phua had been in the rooms at the Wynn Macau by chance, arriving for a meeting on a potential business project just minutes before the police raid. The prosecution has 20 days to appeal the verdict.

column3: US v Phua, 14-cr-00249, US District Court, District of Nevada (Las Vegas).
column4: The FBI alleged, in a Nevada court indictment, that Mr Phua is a "high-ranking member" of the feared Asian crime syndicate, the 14K Triad.
column5: The judge ruled that prosecutors had failed to connect all the evidence to Phua and other defendants in the case. Thomas Goldstein, one of the defense lawyers, said he was grateful to the court for recognizing his client’s innocence and the defense argued that Phua had been in the rooms at the Wynn Macau by chance. On delivering his verdict, the judge said the Public Prosecution Office had failed to prove that the computers and papers seized from the rooms belonged to the defendants and police were unable to provide any evidence linking Phua’s phone or computer records to illegal betting activity. The prosecution has 20 days to appeal the verdict.
